name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoic acid has a melting point around 120°C. The methyl ester group (COC(=O)) has a lower melting point than the carboxylic acid group due to the loss of hydrogen bonding. The methyl group can increase the melting point by approximately +5°C due to the increase in molecular weight.
